title: Massachusetts says to probe Facebook, Cambridge Analytica
text: March 17, 2018 / 5:32 PM / Updated an hour ago Massachusetts says to probe Facebook, Cambridge Analytica Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The Massachusetts attorney general said on Saturday her office was launching an investigation after reports that Cambridge Analytica had harvested private information from more than 50 million Facebook users in developing techniques to support President Donald Trump’s 2016 election campaign. A giant logo is seen at Facebook's headquarters in London, Britain, December 4, 2017. REUTERS/Toby Melville “Massachusetts residents deserve answers immediately from Facebook and Cambridge Analytica. We are launching an investigation,” Maura Healey said on Twitter in a post that linked to a New York Times report on the issue. Reporting by David Brunnstrom; Editing by Paul Simao
